statements: SELECT * FROM AirQualityData;
SELECT sensor_location, temperature FROM AirQualityData;
SELECT humidity, pollution_level FROM AirQualityData;
SELECT sensor_id, timestamp FROM AirQualityData;
SELECT sensor_location, temperature, humidity FROM AirQualityData;
SELECT sensor_id, sensor_location FROM AirQualityData WHERE pollution_level > 50 ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT * FROM AirQualityData WHERE temperature BETWEEN 20 AND 30 ORDER BY sensor_id ASC;
SELECT sensor_id, sensor_location, pollution_level, temperature, humidity FROM AirQualityData WHERE humidity < 40 ORDER BY pollution_level DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT sensor_id, sensor_location, temperature FROM AirQualityData WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31' ORDER BY temperature ASC;
SELECT sensor_id, sensor_location, temperature, humidity FROM AirQualityData WHERE pollution_level > 40 AND temperature > 25 ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 8;
SELECT * FROM sensors
SELECT sensor_id, location FROM sensors
SELECT location, sensor_type FROM sensors WHERE sensor_type='Temperature Sensor'
SELECT * FROM air_quality_data
SELECT data_id, sampled_at, pollution_level FROM air_quality_data WHERE pollution_level > 50
SELECT * FROM sensors;
SELECT sensor_id, location, sensor_type FROM sensors WHERE sensor_status = 'active';
SELECT * FROM air_quality_data WHERE pollution_level > 100 ORDER BY sampled_at DESC;
SELECT sensor_id, AVG(temperature) AS avg_temperature, AVG(humidity) AS avg_humidity FROM air_quality_data GROUP BY sensor_id HAVING COUNT(sensor_id) > 10;

SELECT MAX(temperature) AS max_temperature, MIN(temperature) AS min_temperature, AVG(temperature) AS avg_temperature FROM air_quality_data WHERE humidity > 50 GROUP BY sensor_id HAVING COUNT(sensor_id) < 5;
SELECT * FROM sensors;
SELECT sensor_name, location FROM sensors WHERE sensor_type = 'Temperature';
SELECT sensor_name, location, sensor_type FROM sensors ORDER BY location DESC;
SELECT sensor_name, location FROM sensors WHERE sensor_type = 'Humidity' ORDER BY sensor_name ASC;
SELECT sensor_id, sensor_name, location, sensor_type FROM sensors WHERE location LIKE '%City%';
SELECT * FROM sensors;
SELECT sensor_id, sensor_name, sensor_type FROM sensors WHERE location = 'Indoor';
SELECT data_id, pm_2_5_level, temperature, humidity FROM air_quality_data ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT * FROM public_health_data WHERE health_condition = 'Unhealthy' AND public_health_advisory = 'Stay indoors';

SELECT sensors.sensor_name, air_quality_data.pm_10_level, public_health_data.health_condition FROM sensors JOIN air_quality_data ON sensors.sensor_id = air_quality_data.sensor_id JOIN public_health_data ON air_quality_data.data_id = public_health_data.data_id WHERE sensors.location = 'Outdoor' AND air_quality_data.pm_10_level > 50 ORDER BY air_quality_data.pm_10_level DESC;
SELECT * FROM sensors;
SELECT location, reading_date FROM sensors ORDER BY reading_date DESC;
SELECT city_name, population, latitude, longitude FROM cities WHERE population > 1000000;
SELECT impact_id, city_id, health_condition FROM health_impact WHERE health_condition = 'Critical';
SELECT reading_id, sensor_id, value AS pollution_level FROM readings ORDER BY value DESC;
SELECT * FROM sensors ORDER BY reading_date DESC, pollution_level ASC;
SELECT city_name, population FROM cities WHERE population > 1000000;

SELECT r.reading_id, s.location, r.value, h.health_condition FROM sensors s JOIN readings r ON s.sensor_id = r.sensor_id JOIN health_impact h ON r.reading_id = h.reading_id WHERE s.location = 'New York' AND h.health_condition = 'Critical';
SELECT city_name, SUM(population) AS total_population FROM cities GROUP BY city_name HAVING total_population > 500000;
SELECT s.sensor_id, s.location, r.value, c.city_name FROM sensors s JOIN readings r ON s.sensor_id = r.sensor_id JOIN cities c ON s.location = c.city_name;
SELECT * FROM sensors ORDER BY sensor_id DESC;
SELECT city_name, population FROM cities WHERE region = 'Europe';
SELECT sensor_id, measurement_type, measurement_value FROM sensors WHERE measurement_value > 50;
SELECT health_condition, affected_population FROM health_data WHERE city_id = 1;
SELECT city_name, population, region FROM cities ORDER BY region, population DESC;
SELECT * FROM sensors WHERE measurement_type = 'temperature';
SELECT city_name, population, region FROM cities ORDER BY population DESC;
SELECT MAX(pollution_level) AS highest_pollution_level, city_id FROM pollution_data GROUP BY city_id;
SELECT sensor_id, AVG(measurement_value) AS average_measurement_value FROM sensors GROUP BY sensor_id HAVING AVG(measurement_value) > 50;
SELECT city_name, health_condition, affected_population FROM cities c JOIN health_data h ON c.city_id = h.city_id WHERE affected_population > 10000 ORDER BY affected_population DESC;
